Name: Establishing a one-year pilot program for recycling in certain parks.
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to establishing a one-year pilot program for recycling in certain parks.
BodyName: Committee on Sanitation and Solid Waste Management

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Sanitation and Solid Waste Management
This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
History.BodyName: Committee on Sanitation and Solid Waste Management

History.Description: This Introduction was Laid Over by Committee
History.BodyName: Committee on Sanitation and Solid Waste Management

History.Description: This Introduction was Sine Die (Filed, End of Session)

Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows: 
	
Section 1. Subchapter 7 of chapter 3 of title 16 of the administrative code of the city of New York is amended by adding a new section 16-326 to read as follows:
§16-326 Pilot public recycling program. a.  The department shall conduct a pilot program for one year, commencing on May first, two thousand eight, that will collect recyclable materials, including, but not limited to, metal, plastic, glass, and paper, in certain public parks. The pilot program shall include the development by the department, in conjunction with the department of parks and recreation, of a list of thirty parks, evenly distributed throughout the city’s five boroughs, that have within them areas of significant pedestrian traffic that are accessible to collection trucks.  In each such park, the department shall install in those areas of significant pedestrian traffic, bins for the collection of such recyclable materials as are included in the pilot program.  The department shall regularly collect recyclables and record for each such park the amounts of each recycled material collected.  No later than September first, two thousand nine, the department shall report the results of the pilot program to the mayor and the council together with any recommendations regarding the expansion of the program.
§2. This local law shall take effect immediately upon enactment and shall be repealed and be of no further force and effect on December thirty first, two thousand nine.
CJC/12/12
LS #4532
